title: How to find free music to use in iMovie - Quora

response.answer_text: Ok so there are many sites offering free music but I think you will find what you’re looking for right here : Free Royalty Free Music with over 200 tacks so far and growing. If you can do a little sound editing which isn’t difficult you can create your free YouTube music from this playlist. Also try: NCS Facebook No Copy Right Sound has music for download. Free Music Archive has free music downloads. Royalty Free Music For Free has a large selection of downloadable background music and loops. BenSounds has a great selection of Free Royalty Free music. Archive Audio has a huge selection of free music. Sound have a large selection of music mostly paid but search for free. Freesound have a large selection of loops and music. GrooveDen have a large selection of royalty free music. AudioGrab is a good place to find free music. Incompetech has royalty free music. Machinimasound have paid music downloads. Technoaxe have a large selection of free music. MacLoops have a huge selection of free loops. Music Revolution has a big selection of downloadable music. MyFreeRoyaltyFree Soundcloud Playlist. These are the sites I use then just do a little editing, cut n paste, loop etc in GarageBand or any music, sound editing software.

The term you are looking for is Royalty Free, but finding the right music and the right source and file types may prove difficult. There are many collections behind paywalls. Consider making your own music in GarageBand, all the loops and instruments that come with it are royalty free so any music you make with it is yours. There are also companies that produce sounds and loops and instruments. Read the fine print. If you cannot fully own the work when you produce with their loops, hard pass. You can use up to 30 seconds of commercial music, but there are also some other exclusions to copywriter under Fair Use. So look up fair use and learn about satire, original to new works, etc. Consult an atty if you are uncertain. This is not legal advice, it is simply advice. Do your own research. Have fun making films.
